duck: Lénárt sphere - A Lénárt sphere is a teaching and educational research model for Non-Euclidean geometry, especially spherical geometry, spherical trigonometry, and projective geometry.

trigonometry definition: the study of the properties of triangles and trigonometric functions and of their applications.
Generalized trigonometry - Ordinary trigonometry studies triangles in the euclidean plane R2.

Trigonometry (from Greek trigōnon "triangle" + metron "measure") is a branch of mathematics that studies triangles and the relationships between the lengths of their sides and the angles between those sides.

robotic manipulator on the International Space Station is operated by
 controlling the angles of its joints. Calculating the final position of the
 astronaut at the end of the arm requires repeated use of trigonometric
 functions of those angles.]]


'Trigonometry' (from Greek [[wikt:τρίγωνον|trigōnon]] "triangle" +
[[wikt:μέτρον|metron]] "measure"<ref></ref>) is a branch of mathematics that
studies triangles and the relationships between the lengths of their sides and
the angles between those sides. Trigonometry defines the trigonometric
functions, which describe those relationships and have applicability to cyclical
phenomena, such as waves. The field evolved during the third century BC as a
branch of geometry used extensively for astronomical studies.<ref>R. Nagel
(ed.), Encyclopedia of Science, 2nd Ed., The Gale Group (2002)</ref> It is also
the foundation of the practical art of surveying.

Trigonometry basics are often taught in school either as a separate course or as
part of a precalculus course. The trigonometric functions are pervasive in parts
of pure mathematics and applied mathematics such as Fourier analysis and the
wave equation, which are in turn essential to many branches of science and
technology. Spherical trigonometry studies triangles on spheres, surfaces of
constant positive curvature, in elliptic geometry. It is fundamental to
astronomy and navigation. Trigonometry on surfaces of negative curvature is part
of hyperbolic geometry.
wiki.title: trigonometry
